definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: I graduated and now want to get a BA.
sentences.chinese: 我已经毕业了，现在将取得文学士学位。

sentences.english: She graduated from Qinghua University with the B. A. degree in 2002.
sentences.chinese: 她2002年毕业于清华大学，获文学士学位。

sentences.english: But I was awarded my BA in January of 1996.
sentences.chinese: 不过我还是在1996年1月被授予了文学士学位。

sentences.english: Students in the arts and humanities get a B.
sentences.chinese: 文科学生最终获取文学士，简称为B。

sentences.english: All my co-workers have graduate degrees, and all I have is a B. A.
sentences.chinese: 我所有的同事都是研究生毕业，而我只是个文学士。

sentences.english: The degree of B.A. was awarded to her.
She was the first deafblind person to earn a Bachelor of Arts degree.
sentences.chinese: 她是第一个获得文学士学位的盲聋人。

definition: PhD degree (Doctor of Philosophy)/also abbr. to 博士學位|博士学位
pinyin: zhe2 xue2 bo2 shi4 xue2 wei4

definition: doctoral degree/PhD/same as Doctor of Philosophy 哲學博士學位|哲学博士学位

pinyin: gong1 shang1 guan3 li3 shuo4 shi4

definition: to major (in a field)/to study a specialty to obtain a higher degree
master's degree/person who has a master's degree/learned person

pinyin: Ge1 lun2 bi3 ya4 Da4 xue2
